content:
Hi there - I need to use Lean 3 (as opposed to Lean 4) in VSC. I have downloaded the "lean" extension from "leanprover" through the extensions market; however, when working in a .lean file, I get the following error:

Watchdog error: Cannot read LSP request: A Lean 3 request was received. Please ensure that your editor has a Lean 4 compatible extension installed. For VSCode, this is

https://github.com/leanprover/vscode-lean4

What do I need to do to fix this error?

cheers, Jack
What language does vscode think the file is in the bottom right corner? It should say "lean" not "Lean 4"

Eric Wieser said:

What language does vscode think the file is in the bottom right corner? It should say "lean" not "Lean 4"

Bottom right does say "Lean" :-(
Do you have a lean3 project open?
Or is this a lean3 file by itself?
This is just a lean file by itself. I'm new to lean and I'm trying to get set up so I can study some of my course materials

The course should really have provided instructions on how to set up a lean project (or better yet, provided you with one); you can make a new one with leanproject new, but you will have to guess what version of mathlib the course expects you to use.
(Of course, the course should also probably have switched to Lean 4, but that's out of your control...)

For completeness, I managed to get this working over the last hour. Issue was that somehow I had a version of Lean 4 installed through elan (don't remember ever clicking on anything for this). Removing this from my user directory, deleting lean, and reinstalling through homebrew has left me with what I needed :-).

Thanks for your help.
Jack has marked this topic as resolved.

Jack said:

For completeness, I managed to get this working over the last hour. Issue was that somehow I had a version of Lean 4 installed through elan (don't remember ever clicking on anything for this). Removing this from my user directory, deleting lean, and reinstalling through homebrew has left me with what I needed :-).

Thanks for your help.

It should not be a problem to have lean 4 installed through elan, because it will manage both lean 3 and lean 4 and pick the right one based on the context. In particular we recommend not installing lean via your system package manager, but rather installing elan and using that to get the right version of lean. This will cause fewer problems if you want to use another version later.
